newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Gencor intends finalising CVRD alliance.
newsitem.headline: Gencor intends finalising CVRD alliance.

text.p: Gencor Ltd said on Thursday it intended to finalise a strategic alliance with the consortium which landed the winning bid for Brazilian state mining giant Companhia Vale do Rio Doce (CVRD).

Gencor, who signed a memorandum of understanding with the winning Valepar consortium, said it was committed to engage in post-auction discussions "to define how Gencor's industry skills will be applied to assist the new owners in coming to grips with the CVRD challenge".
The consortium paid 3.338 billion reais for a 41.73 percent voting stake in CVRD.
"We also intend to finalise details of a strategic alliance aimed at benefiting the shareholders of all parties, and of CVRD.
"In the process we will explore whether it makes sense for us to participate directly in the company," Gencor executive director Dave Munro said in a statement.
Gencor said it was seeking to strengthen and expand both its commodity businesses and its global marketing and trading operations in metals an minerals through its involvement in CVRD.
The Valepar consortium still has the option to raise its controlling stake to 45 percent of voting shares.
The consortium includes NationsBank Corp, Banco Safra, investment fund Opportunity Asset Management, and four Brazilian pension funds.
Paper and pulp firm Cia Suzano de Papel and Celulose is also in the group.
